meta.title: store/sku/inventory/order/updated - Models - Webhooks - Management APIs - API Reference
meta.description:
This webhook fires when the inventory is updated.Fields that trigger event:Quantity

Example callback:



Callback schema:

blocks.data:
This webhook fires when the inventory is updated.

Fields that trigger event:
  • Quantity
### Example callback: ```json { "created_at": 1561482670, "store_id": "1025646", "producer": "stores/{store_hash}", "scope": "store/sku/inventory/order/updated", "hash": "352e4afc6dd3fc85ea26bfdf3f91852604d57528", "data": { "type": "sku", "id": 461, "inventory": { "product_id": 167, "method": "absolute", "value": 2, "variant_id": 509 } } } ``` ### Callback schema:

created_at.description: Hook creation date as a Unix timestamp.

store_id.description: A numerical identifier that is unique to each store.

producer.description: Will always follow the pattern `stores/store_hash`. This is the store that created the webhook.

scope.description: The event registered when the webhook was created.

hash.description: The payload data JSON encoded then passed through SH1 encryption.

allOf.description: A lightweight description of the event that triggered the webhook. Will vary depending on the event registered.

data.description: A lightweight description of the event that triggered the webhook. Will vary depending on the event registered.

method.description:
How the inventory was adjusted. Value will be one of the following:
- `absolute` - inventory updated by an order
- `relative` - inventory updated using the API or the control panel

value.description: the number of items that the inventory changed by. This can be negative if the inventory is decreased `-3` or positive if an item is returned to the inventory from an order, `2`
